A factory has two machines that make widgets. Machine A can make 120 widgets per hour, while Machine B can make 150 widgets per hour. If Machine A runs for 6 hours and Machine B runs for 4 hours, how many more widgets will Machine B have made than Machine A?

Machine A makes 120 widgets per hour * 6 hours = <<120*6=720>>720 widgets.
Machine B makes 150 widgets per hour * 4 hours = <<150*4=600>>600 widgets.
Machine A made 720 - 600 = <<720-600=120>>120 more widgets than Machine B.
#### 120

The rate at which the apprentice works is 1/16 houses per hour, or <<1/16=0.0625>>0.063 houses per hour.
Together, they paint at a rate of 0.083 + 0.063 = <<0.083+0.063=0.146>>0.146 houses per hour.
To paint 3 houses at this rate, it will take them 3 / 0.146 = <<3/0.146=20.547945205479454>>21 hours.

A landscaper charges $50 per hour for their services. They worked for 3 hours on Monday, 2.5 hours on Tuesday, and 5 hours on Wednesday before taking the rest of the week off. How much more money did they earn on Wednesday compared to Monday and Tuesday combined?

The landscaper earned $50 * 3 = $<<50*3=150>>150 on Monday.
On Tuesday, they earned $50 * 2.5 = $<<50*2.5=125>>125.
So on Monday and Tuesday combined, they earned $150 + $125 = $<<150+125=275>>275.
On Wednesday, the landscaper earned $50 * 5 = $<<50*5=250>>250.
Therefore, the landscaper earned $250 - $275 = $<<250-275=-25>>-25 more on Wednesday compared to Monday and Tuesday combined.
#### -25

A turtle travels at a rate of 1 mile every 2 hours. A rabbit travels at a rate of 4 miles per hour. The turtle has a 12 mile head start on the rabbit. How many hours will it take the rabbit to catch up to the turtle?

The turtle travels at a rate of 0.5 miles per hour, since it goes 1 mile every 2 hours.
In the time it takes the rabbit to catch up, the turtle will have traveled 0.5 miles per hour * h hours = <<0.5*h=0.5h>>0.5h miles beyond its initial 12 mile head start. 
The rabbit travels 4 miles per hour, so in h hours it will have gone 4 miles per hour * h hours = <<4*h=4h>>4h miles.
To catch up, the rabbit must travel the turtle's initial 12 mile lead plus the 0.5h miles the turtle travels in the meantime.
So, 4h = 12 + 0.5h
4h - 0.5h = 12
3.5h = 12
h = 12/3.5 = <<12/3.5=3.43>>3.43
Rounding to the nearest hour, it will take the rabbit <<round(3.43)=3>>3 hours to catch the turtle.
#### 3

In the same 5 days, he can fix 40/3 = <<40/3=13.333333>>13 toilets.
So in 5 days, the plumber can fix 20 - 13 = <<20-13=7>>7 more sinks than toilets.

A printing press can print 500 pages in 10 minutes. A newer printing press can print 750 pages in 12 minutes. How many more pages per hour can the newer printing press print compared to the older one?

The newer printing press prints at a rate of 750 pages / 12 minutes = 62.5 pages per minute.
In one hour, it prints 62.5 pages per minute * 60 minutes = <<62.5*60=3750>>3750 pages.
Therefore, the newer printing press can print 3750 - 3000 = <<3750-3000=750>>750 more pages per hour than the older one.

A factory worker assembles fidget spinners at a rate of 40 spinners per hour. After working for 3 hours, he takes a 15-minute break. How many more spinners would he have assembled in total if he had not taken the break and instead maintained his initial rate?

Initially, the worker assembled spinners at a rate of 40 per hour for 3 hours, making 40*3=<<40*3=120>>120 spinners.
After his break, he assembled spinners at 35 per hour for 2 hours, making 35*2=<<35*2=70>>70 spinners.
In total, he made 120+70=<<120+70=190>>190 spinners.
If he had not taken a break and maintained his initial rate of 40 per hour, in the additional 2.25 hours (3 hours + 15 minutes), he would have made 40*2.25=<<40*2.25=90>>90 more spinners.
So without the break, he would have assembled 120+90=<<120+90=210>>210 spinners total.
Therefore, he would have made 210-190=<<210-190=20>>20 more spinners if he had not taken the break.

At 120 widgets per hour, Bob's machine produces 120 * 7 = <<120*7=840>>840 widgets.

Tom's machine starts 2 hours after Bob's and runs continuously, so it runs for 7 - 2 = <<7-2=5>>5 hours. 
At 150 widgets per hour, Tom's machine produces 150 * 5 = <<150*5=750>>750 widgets.

Therefore, Bob's machine produced 840 - 750 = <<840-750=90>>90 more widgets than Tom's machine that day.

A leaky pipe drips at a rate of 2 drops per minute. There are 50 drops in one teaspoon. The pipe drips into a 1 gallon container that is currently 1/4 full. If 768 teaspoons equal 1 gallon, how many hours will it take for the container to completely fill up?

First, let's find how many teaspoons are in 1/4 gallon:
1 gallon = 768 teaspoons
1/4 gallon = 768/4 = <<768/4=192>>192 teaspoons

The container already has 192 teaspoons, so it needs 768 - 192 = <<768-192=576>>576 more teaspoons to be full.

The pipe drips 2 drops per minute, which is 2/50 = <<2/50=0.04>>0.04 teaspoons per minute.

To find how many minutes it will take to fill the remaining 576 teaspoons:
576 teaspoons / 0.04 teaspoons per minute = <<576/0.04=14400>>14400 minutes

To convert minutes to hours:
14400 minutes / 60 minutes per hour = <<14400/60=240>>240 hours

Therefore, it will take 240 hours for the container to completely fill up.

The pool can hold 1000 gallons, so Kelly needs to fill it with 1000 - 300 = <<1000-300=700>>700 more gallons.
At a rate of 10 gallons per minute, it will take Kelly 700 / 10 = <<700/10=70>>70 more minutes to finish filling the pool after her phone call.
